results.title: Impressions of Hong Kong and Macau
results.creator_credit: James Omi, Patrick Sun and Video Postcard Souvenirs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Jetfoils and junks, sampans and ferries skim across the harbour as you begin your visit to Hong Kong. Push through the crowded streets of this bustling financial centre and enjoy the folk theatre performances going on all around. Shop in the street markets and elegant department stores. Enjoy a change of pace in the outer islands, dotted with quiet fishing villages, serene monasteries and isolated beaches. Visit Macau, the oldest European settlement in Asia.

results.title: Impressionism
results.brief_description: Discusses the unique qualities of impressionism and shows examples of impressionistic master-pieces. The techniques are contrasted with the detailed photographic techniques of some former schools. Points of departure are in the selection of everyday subjects, the use of intense contrasts of light and shadow and bold generalised patterns using heavy applications of paint to give great action and movement.
results.description: Discusses the unique qualities of impressionism and shows examples of impressionistic master-pieces. The techniques are contrasted with the detailed photographic techniques of some former schools. Points of departure are in the selection of everyday subjects, the use of intense contrasts of light and shadow and bold generalised patterns using heavy applications of paint to give great action and movement.

results.title: Impossible touch
results.brief_description: Effective use of experimental camerawork and editing adds complexity to a story of the hesitation and intensity of yearning. This work is an evocation of a shared imagining of what might be. An original soundtrack contributes a sense of journey within the relationship.

results.title: Importance of goals
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
Follows the case of a 13 year-old boy to illustrate the principle that all education is essentially a process of attaining basic, meaningful goals. In the class-room, the child is bored. Outside, a series of incidents are used to show that the child shows interest where a tangible goal provides the necessary incentive to make him want to learn. Something to work toward, in terms of young minds and young desires, can spell the difference between eager, interested students, and those for whom school is both boring and dull.

results.title: Imperialism and European expansion
results.brief_description: The imperial expansion movement of 1875-1914. The industrial revolution and improved communication as causes; how nationalism, industrial rivalry, technological progress, the search for cheap raw materials and missionary activity affected it. Military, governmental and business movements into underdeveloped countries and the effect on the lives of subject peoples.
